data.title: In Theaters
data.meta_description: Now playing and coming soon to SIFF Cinema Downtown, SIFF Cinema Egyptian, SIFF Cinema Uptown, and SIFF Film Center.
data.text:
Barbie

USA | 2023 | Greta Gerwig

Now Playing - Jul 24, 2024

SIFF Cinema Downtown

To live in Barbie Land is to be a perfect being in a perfect place. Unless you have a full-on existential crisis. Or you’re a Ken. Wear a "Barbenheimer" t-shirt to a screening for a free fountain soda.

More Details

Fantastic Fungi

USA | 2019 | 80 min. | Louie Schwartzberg

Now Playing - Jul 25, 2024

SIFF Cinema Uptown

Originally released in 2019, Fantastic Fungi quickly dazzled critics and moviegoers worldwide with its stunning visuals, captivating storytelling, and enlightening exploration of the interconnectedness of all life forms. Now, five years later, audiences will have the opportunity to rediscover this cinematic masterpiece in a whole new light.

More Details

Kinds of Kindness

USA | 2024 | 164 min. | Yorgos Lanthimos

Now Playing

SIFF Cinema Uptown

Kinds of Kindness is a triptych fable, following a man without choice who tries to take control of his own life; a policeman who is alarmed that his wife who was missing-at-sea has returned and seems a different person; and a woman determined to find a specific someone with a special ability, who is destined to become a prodigious spiritual leader.

More Details

Thelma

USA | 2024 | 97 min. | Josh Margolin

Now Playing

SIFF Cinema Uptown

June Squibb stars as a woman who gets scammed out of $10,000 and embarks on a daring mission across Los Angeles to recover it.

More Details

The Terminator

USA | 1984 | 107 min. | James Cameron

July 25, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

In 2029, the war between man and machine has desolated the Earth, leaving humanity all but wiped out. Pockets of survivors remain - either living as slaves serving their technological overlords, or as resistance fighters attempting to overthrow the sentient defence network that controls the machines.

More Details

Adios Buenos Aires

Germany | 2022 | 93 min. | German Kral

Opens July 26, 2024

SIFF Cinema Uptown

Buenos Aires, November 2001. Argentina is embroiled in crisis, with the peso plunging deeper and deeper. Julio Färber, the charismatic bandoneon player of the "Vecinos de Pompeya," a five-piece working-class tango band, is trying to keep his head above water, but every month he is earning less and less from their gigs as well as from the traditional shoe shop he inherited from his father.

More Details

Rewind, Be Kind: Scooby-Doo

USA | 2002 | 89 min. | Raja Gosnell

July 26, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

Zoinks! In the first live-action Scooby-Doo film, we find Mystery, Inc. hesitantly reconnecting on a horror-themed tropical island vacation. Some may roll their eyes at a modern adaptation of Scooby-Doo, but we consider this to be a comedic Zillennial masterpiece!

More Details

Rewind, Be Kind: Josie and the Pussycats

USA | 2001 | 98 min. | Deborah Kaplan, Harry Elfont

July 27, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

A small-town rock band has a chance at fame and fortune when plucked from obscurity and offered a record deal from a major label. But what is the cost? Directors Deborah Kaplan and Harry Elfont in attendance for an in-person Q&A.

More Details

Rewind, Be Kind: The Mummy

USA | 1999 | 124 min. | Stephen Sommers

July 27, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

At an archaeological dig in the ancient city of Hamunaptra, an American serving in the French Foreign Legion accidentally awakens a mummy who begins to wreak havoc as he searches for the reincarnation of his long-lost love. Director Stephen Sommers in attendance for an in-person Q&A.

More Details

Rewind, Be Kind: Uptown Girls

USA | 2003 | 92 min. | Boaz Yakin

July 27, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

Brittany Murphy stars in Uptown Girls as a New York City it-girl and daughter of a deceased rock star. When she loses her trust fund, she begins working as a nanny for an uptight eight-year-old (Dakota Fanning). Initially maligned by critics for being an immature chick flick with a specific focus on the female leads being “unlikeable”, Uptown Girls stands the test of time as a heartbreaking coming-of-age story.

More Details

Rewind, Be Kind: Van Helsing

USA | 2004 | 131 min. | Stephen Sommers

July 27, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

Hugh Jackman stars as the titular Van Helsing who must face off against Dracula and a monster mash of classic Universal creatures in a movie that Roger Ebert called “...silly and spectacular, and fun.” We think he was right. Director Stephen Sommers in attendance for an in-person Q&A.

More Details

Rewind, Be Kind: Lady in the Water

USA | 2006 | 110 min. | M. Night Shyamalan

July 28, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

M. Night Shyamalan crafts a fairy tale about a jaded superintendent (Paul Giamatti) who discovers a water nymph in the community pool and is tasked with returning her to her blue world. Both a critical and financial failure, this one is too beautiful and sincere to dismiss as a strike.

More Details

Rewind, Be Kind: Sunshine (35mm)

United Kingdom | 2007 | 107 min. | Danny Boyle

July 28, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

Sunshine has us join a team of eight international astronauts aboard the Icarus II, a ship on a mission to reignite our dying sun. Despite impressive visuals and a stacked cast, audiences didn’t take to Danny Boyle’s sci-fi thriller. Even so, this ship merits a ride in our book. Presented on 35mm.

More Details

Rewind, Be Kind: The Phantom of the Opera

United Kingdom | 2004 | 143 min. | Joel Schumacher

July 28, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

Joel Schumacher brings Andrew Lloyd Webber’s “The Phantom of the Opera” to the silver screen. Despite this film being one of Schumacher’s largest spectacles, critics had an inconsistent list of complaints. We feel that The Phantom of the Opera is a beautiful dream that deserves a revisit!

More Details

Scope Screenings

USA | 3 hours

July 30, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

Join us at Scope Screenings for a monthly celebration of cinema and community. Each session features a diverse lineup of narrative shorts, music videos, and feature trailers. Doors open at 6:30 PM for socializing, with screenings kicking off at 7:30 PM, creating a dynamic hub for creatives and film enthusiasts alike.

More Details

Kneecap

Ireland | 2024 | Rich Peppiatt

Opens August 1, 2024

SIFF Cinema Uptown

There are 80,000 native Irish speakers in Ireland. 6,000 live in the North of Ireland. Three of them became a rap group called Kneecap. This anarchic Belfast trio becomes the unlikely figurehead of a civil rights movement to save the mother tongue.

More Details

Widow Clicquot

France | 2023 | 90 min. | Thomas Napper

Opens August 2, 2024

SIFF Cinema Uptown

After her husband's death, Madame Clicquot flouts convention by assuming the reins of their wine business, defying her critics and ultimately revolutionizing the champagne industry, establishing her as one of the world's first great businesswomen.

More Details

AGFA August: Donnie Darko (4k Restoration)

USA | 2001 | 113 min. | Richard Kelly

August 3, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

A troubled teenager is plagued by visions of a man in a large rabbit suit who manipulates him to commit a series of crimes, after he narrowly escapes a bizarre accident. New 4K Restoration. Introduced by AGFA Executive Director Jackson Cooper.

More Details

Munch: Love, Ghosts and Lady Vampires

90 min. | Michele Mally

Opens August 3, 2024

SIFF Film Center

Munch: Love, Ghosts and Lady Vampires strives to shed new light on Edvard Munch, a profoundly mysterious, fascinating man, a trailblazer and a master for everyone who came after him.

More Details

Cuckoo (35mm)

Germany | 2024 | 103 min. | Tilman Singer

August 4, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

Reluctantly, 17-year-old Gretchen leaves her American home to live with her father, who has just moved into a resort in the German Alps with his new family. However, something doesn't seem right in this tranquil vacation paradise, and Gretchen is plagued by strange noises and bloody visions until she discovers a shocking secret that also concerns her own family. Presented on 35mm.

More Details

Walking with M

India | 2023 | 120 min. | Akash Sagar Chopra

August 4, 2024

SIFF Film Center

This film is based on Sri M's 7500 km peace-march in 2015-2016 from Kanyakumari to Kashmir in India with the mission of Unity of Mankind and to revive an old mission to rekindle India's ancient values of compassion, acceptance and human understanding. The first 20 SIFF members to arrive can see the film for free as a courtesy from the Blossom Foundation!

More Details

AGFA August: Terminal USA

USA | 1993 | 60 min. | Jon Mortisugu

August 5, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

This is Moritsugu’s asian freak-out magnum opus that shocked America when it was broadcast on television in the mid-90’s! The director himself plays twins (a drug-dealing bad-ass and a closeted math nerd) in a radically dysfunctional family that completely obliterates the noble myth of the “model minority.” Introduced by AGFA Executive Director Jackson Cooper.

More Details

Heaven Adores You

USA | 2014 | 104 min. | Nickolas Rossi

August 6, 2024

SIFF Cinema Uptown

Celebrating the 10th anniversary of the film's release Heaven Adores You returns to theaters for a special event screening on August 6, which would have been the 55th birthday of Elliott Smith.

More Details

AGFA August: Blood Feast

USA | 1963 | 67 min. | Herschell Gordon Lewis

August 7, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

The insane Ramses hypnotizes a socialite in order to land a job catering a party for her debutante daughter, and turns the event into an evening of gruesome deaths, bloody dismemberment and ritual sacrifice. Introduced by AGFA Executive Director Jackson Cooper.

More Details

Movie Club: The Crow

USA | 1994 | 102 min. | Alex Proyas

August 7, 2024

SIFF Cinema Uptown

The tale of a young musician Eric Draven who, along with his fiancé, is murdered on the eve of their Halloween wedding. Exactly one year after their deaths, Eric is risen from the grave by a mysterious crow to seek out his killers and force them to answer for their crimes. Introduced by SIFF Cinema staffer Milo Harms.

More Details

AGFA August: Attack of the Beast Creatures (New Restoration)

USA | 1985 | 80 min. | Mike Stanley

August 8, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

A group of survivors wash up on the shores of a seemingly deserted island after their ship capsizes.It slowly becomes apparent that the island is home to a tribe of small doll-like creatures, who begin stalking and killing the survivors one by one. Introduced by AGFA Executive Director Jackson Cooper.

More Details

AGFA August: Indecent Desires (New Restoration)

USA | 1968 | 75 min. | Doris Wishman

August 8, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

Zeb finds a doll and a ring in a garbage can. He realizes the doll looks like Ann, his neighbor. When he realizes Ann experiences everything he does to the doll, he starts to unwind. Introduced by AGFA Executive Director Jackson Cooper.

More Details

Burden of Dreams (New 4K Restoration)

USA | 1982 | 94 min. | Les Blank, Maureen Gosling

Opens August 9, 2024

SIFF Film Center

Burden of Dreams captures legendary director Werner Herzog’s filming of his most ambitious film Fitzcarraldo, in which an entrepreneur (Klaus Kinski) endeavors to push a steamship over a mountain to build an opera house deep in the Amazon jungle. New 4K restoration.

More Details

Alien: Romulus

United Kingdom | 2024 | Fede Alvarez

Opens August 15, 2024

SIFF Cinema Downtown

The sci-fi/horror-thriller takes the phenomenally successful “Alien” franchise back to its roots: While scavenging the deep ends of a derelict space station, a group of young space colonizers come face to face with the most terrifying life form in the universe.

More Details

Made in England: The Films of Powell & Pressburger

United Kingdom | 2024 | 131 min. | David Hinton

Opens August 16, 2024

SIFF Cinema Uptown

Martin Scorsese first encountered the films of Powell and Pressburger as a child, sitting in front of the family TV. When The Archers’ famous logo appeared on screen, Scorsese recalls: “You knew you were in for fantasy, wonder, magic – real film magic.” Now, in this documentary, he tells the story of his lifelong love affair with their movies.

More Details

Picasso: A Rebel in Paris

2024 | 90 min. | Simona Risi

Opens August 17, 2024

SIFF Film Center

Fifty years after his passing, we embark on a journey through Pablo Picasso's Paris, amidst sunshine and shadow, convictions and contradictions, from a young, impoverished foreigner to one of the most important icons of the 20th-century.

More Details

AGFA August: The Films of the Gay Girls Riding Club (New Restorations)

USA | 1963 | 129 min. | Ray Harrison

August 24, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

A double feature of What Really Happened to Baby Jane (drag parody of "What Ever Happened to Baby Jane?") and All About Alice (a drag queen leads a cast of non-professional actors in a spoof of the film "All About Eve"). Introduction and performance by Seattle Drag Artist Uh-Oh (30 min drag show).

More Details

AGFA August: The Little Shop of Horrors

USA | 1960 | 72 min. | Roger Corman

August 24, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

Seymour Krelboin works in the Skid Row flower shop owned by Mr. Mushnik. In his spare time, Seymour creates a new plant species he names Audrey Junior in honor of his girlfriend Audrey. Introduced by AGFA Executive Director Jackson Cooper.

More Details

AGFA August: The Stairway to Stardom Mixtape

USA | 1972 | 70 min. | Various

August 25, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

From homemade R&B party hits to aggro stand-up comics, from interpretive dance by zombified children to amateur magicians, Stairway to Stardom is an unending treasure trove of bizarro entertainment that has been a staple among tape traders for decades. Introduced by AGFA Executive Director Jackson Cooper.

More Details

AGFA August: I Married a Witch

USA | 1942 | 77 min. | René Clair

August 26, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

As a 17th-century New England witch who comes to take revenge on the 20th-century descendant of the Puritan who persecuted her, Lake is all smolder and disruption. Introduced by SIFF Cinema Program Manager Kasi Gaarenstroom.

More Details

AGFA August: To Be or Not to Be

USA | 1942 | 99 min. | Ernst Lubitsch

August 26, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

Acting couple Joseph and Maria Tura are managing a theatrical troupe when the Nazis invade Poland. Using their skill for impersonation, Joseph and company must confuse the Nazis and stop Siletsky from handing over the list.

More Details

AGFA August: GLOW - The Story of the Gorgeous Ladies of Wrestling

USA | 2012 | 76 min. | Brett Whitcomb

August 28, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

Chronicling the rise and fall of the first ever all-female wrestling show through the stories of those who lived it.

More Details

AGFA August: A Woman Under the Influence

USA | 1974 | 155 min. | John Cassavetes

August 29, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

A housewife on the verge of a nervous breakdown is committed for psychiatric treatment by her loving yet confused husband, with unpredictable results. John Cassavetes’ 1974 masterpiece is one of the most devastating portraits of a relationship ever filmed.

More Details

AGFA August: Faces

USA | 1968 | 130 min. | John Cassavetes

August 29, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

During one long, bumpy night and into the next morning, Richard and Maria Forst, a wealthy couple whose relationship is becalmed in an emotional downswing, dally separately with other partners with devastating results. Preservation of the film funded by The Film Foundation with the Hollywood Foreign Press Association in celebration of the 40th anniversary of this Cassavetes classic.

More Details

AGFA August: Shaolin Invincibles

Taiwan | 1997 | 90 min. | Cheng Hoi

August 30, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

A young woman becomes a great fighter with powerful skills and fights against her enemies after she's allowed to train in 18 forms of Shaolin kung fu in the Shaolin temple by a golden teacher. Introduced by AGFA Executive Director Jackson Cooper.

More Details

Metallica Fest

2024 | 358 min. | Doug Freel & Jean Pellerin; Wayne Isham

August 31, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

Experience three Metallica Concert films on the big screen. The first film, “Cliff ’Em All” serves as a tribute to late original bassist Cliff Burton and is a raw collection of performances from 1983 to 1986. The second concert film, “Cunning Stunts,” shows Metallica pushing boundaries musically during their “Poor Touring Me” Tour. The final film covers three nights at Mexico City with 155,000 crazy Metalli-Fans!

More Details

Edward Scissorhands: Matthew Bourne’s dance version of Tim Burton’s classic

2024 | 95 min. | Matthew Bourne

Opens September 25, 2024

SIFF Film Center

In a castle high on a hill lives Edward; a boy created by an eccentric inventor. When his creator dies he is left alone and unfinished with only scissors for hands until a kindly townswoman invites him to live with her suburban family. Can Edward find his place in the well-meaning community which struggles to see past his curious appearance to the innocence and gentleness within?

More Details

Enchanted Evenings: A Canterbury Tale

United Kingdom | 1944 | 125 min. | Michael Powell, Emeric Pressburger

September 25, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

Like modern-day Chaucer’s seekers on the Pilgrims Way to the Canterbury Cathedral, two young soldiers (Sgt. John Sweet, Dennis Price) meet a woman (Sheila Sim) in the dark, and later confront a perhaps dangerous magus-like landsman who might help enact their spiritual destinies.

More Details

Enchanted Evenings: I Know Where I’m Going!

United Kingdom | 1945 | 92 min. | Michael Powell, Emeric Pressburger

October 2, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

A brash status-obsessed woman (Wendy Hiller) heads north to marry into corporate wealth. But stormy weather strands her on a tiny Hebridean isle, where the landscape, and the alluringly simple life of the locals, seem magical. Are she and the local laird (Roger Livesey) part of an ancient legend? Where is she going?

More Details

Movie Club: Practical Magic

USA | 1998 | 104 min. | Griffin Dunne

October 2, 2024

SIFF Cinema Uptown

Enchanting international superstars Sandra Bullock and Nicole Kidman sparkle in this wry, romantic tale of two sisters who discover the gift of Practical Magic. Introduced by Digital Marketing Associate Helen Paulini.

More Details

Enchanted Evenings: Stairway to Heaven (A Matter of Life and Death)

United Kingdom | 1946 | 104 min. | Michael Powell, Emeric Pressburger

October 9, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

Michael Powell’s favorite film makes reality fantastical, as a pilot (David Niven) bails out without a parachute, having fallen in love with radio operator Kim Hunter’s voice. He survives, they’re in love, but Heaven is short one soul, so Niven must go on trial in a vast celestial amphitheater in order to stay alive. Can the universe’s love manifest as a teardrop? With Roger Livesey.

More Details

Enchanted Evenings: Black Narcissus

United Kingdom | 1947 | 100 min. | Michael Powell, Emeric Pressburger

October 16, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

In the high Himalayas Anglican nuns (Deborah Kerr, Kathleen Byron and company) try to establish a convent school, but the natives’ earthy ways, and the erotic fires of human nature, are seductive. Can “civilization” tame timeless forces? Red lipstick as rebellious liberation.

More Details

Enchanted Evenings: The Red Shoes

United Kingdom | 1948 | 133 min. | Michael Powell, Emeric Pressburger

October 23, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

The Archers’ most famous film feverishly accompanies a young ballerina’s (Moira Shearer) rise to fame. Dedicated to Art, she’s tempted by earthbound love (composer Marius Goring), but her red shoes dance her on and on. The film that launched ballet dancers of all genders.

More Details

Reel Black: The People Under the Stairs

USA | 1991 | 102 min. | Wes Craven

October 27, 2024

SIFF Cinema Uptown

In a sinister mansion, a family stumbles upon a dark secret beneath the stairs, unveiling a twisted realm of horror and oppression.

More Details

Enchanted Evenings: The Small Black Room

United Kingdom | 1949 | 106 min. | Michael Powell, Emeric Pressburger

October 30, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

Brilliant but tormented bomb expert Sammy Rice is drafted into a secret project during World War II concerning a new land mine that German planes have been dropping over England's beaches. But despite the ministrations of his faithful assistant and girlfriend, Susan, Rice's increasingly problematic alcoholism and a recent injury threaten his ability to work.

More Details

Enchanted Evenings: Gone to Earth (35mm)

1950 | 111 min. | Michael Powell, Emeric Pressburger

November 6, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

A nature girl (Jennifer Jones) of the Welsh hills is courted by a pious vicar (Cyril Cusack) and tempted by a roguish squire (DavidFarrar). Amidst an evocatively rendered sense of place, sacred and profane love entwine in the Celtic twilight. Presented on 35mm.

More Details

Movie Club: Koyaanisqatsi

USA | 1982 | 87 min. | Godfrey Reggio

November 6, 2024

SIFF Cinema Uptown

Drawing its title from the Hopi word meaning "life out of balance," this renowned documentary reveals how humanity has grown apart from nature. Introduced by Cinema Rentals Manager Patrick McFarland.

More Details

Reel Black: A Wrinkle in Time

USA | 2018 | 109 min. | Ava DuVernay

November 17, 2024

SIFF Cinema Uptown

Guided by celestial beings, a girl battles darkness to find her father in a visually stunning 2018 adventure of love and self-discovery.

More Details

Enchanted Evenings: Peeping Tom

United Kingdom | 1960 | 101 min. | Michael Powell

November 20, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

A psychologist experiments on his young son, who grows into a gentle, photography-obsessed man (Carl Boehm) who lives to see fear on others’ faces. Can we sympathize with a murderer? Powell calls this a “tender film,” full of empathy for a twisted soul. With Moira Shearer.

More Details
